Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Front Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: Mike C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this great downtown location previously and have always been very satisfied. What prompted me to write this review, however, was an exceptional experience I just had with a staff member on the front desk. I called on two separate occasions, recently, to arrange for a room for my daughter. I spoke with the same staff member both times and the level of customer service I received was absolutely amazingl! She was personable, professional and caring as we worked through the details on the phone, and she treated my daughter the same way during her stays. She made me feel so pleased that I had chosen this location, and confident that I will do so again in the future. What a great customer experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, and great location”
Reviews.Author: Joeabroad
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend in Montreal, and the hotel was perfect for us. It's just around the corner from the McGill campus (in one direction) and the Museum of Fine Arts (in the other), with some quite good restaurants within easy walking distance. It's an older hotel with some oddities--the air conditioner mounted in the center of the window, for instance, but the furniture in our one-bedoom suite was newer and quite comfortable. We were on the 15th floor, and had no problems at all with noise. The breakfast was medium but perfectly adequate, and the staff couldn't have been friendlier. The restaurant next door, Universel, was a great place for brunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for anyboby!”
Reviews.Author: petethepuck
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a hotel that's centrally located and has alot to offer this is one you need stay at. Personnable staff who is always ready to help and very courteous. The room I had rented was spacious and very resonibly priced $159.99 + taxes. I had small kitchenette with 2 double beds and alot of room to have some friends over if I chose to do so. I can only say that this is one of the best hotels I've stayed in and found everything to my liking. Hats off to the staff and management.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in downtown”
Reviews.Author: DAVID1789
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I stayed at this hotel during a Spring Break visit to Montreal. It was the perfect location! Very accessible to everything downtown and, via Metro, to all the attractions we wanted to see in Montreal, including Old Montreal and the Olympic stadium. Plus, the staff were all very helpful and attentive. The free breakfast and afternoon snacks helped us keep control of our food budget, which we appreciated. As expected of a Marriott property, the hotel was clean and comfortable, though nothing lavish. Would recommend staying here if you need a good spot in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and even better staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jpc1974
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wel located, safe area, around lots of action. Rooms were good and the staff was so friendly. I spent 4 nights and there were always a minimum of 2 people at the front desk to handle calls and requests by guests. A good place for business and a good place with kids. During my stay I had 8 other guests stay here as well and they all agreed that the staff was great. I will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: hanm_12
Reviews.Content: We found this an ideal location - in centre of city, convenient facilities, compfortable and clean, with friendly staff. Nice extras too! As ours was an extended stay (10 days) was great to have the kitchen and be able to relax "at home" after a busy day. We're an older couple so sleep fairly light - could hear occasional street noise but no more so than other downtown hotels we've stayed at. Would definitely recommend it and will choose it next time back in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: kingshahid
Reviews.Content: I left this place with mixed feelings. The check-in process was made difficult with 3 trips to my car for the information they wanted to confirm. They wanted my drivers license so I went to get it. The second time around my credit card which they already had on file wasn't swiping through their system so they made me go get another card from my car - second trip to my car. And then the third time I had to go print my discount card I used for a discount on the room rate. Their were three of us staying in a double bed + pullout sofa bed room. The room was cozy itself. Their were black curtains - so if you intend on sleeping during the day - good luck. The room temperature was fine and controllable. The view was alright at the 17th floor looking down to Montreal downtown. The location was great since we were in the core. Parking rate was $25 which was reasonable. The parking was not connected to the Marriot hotel from the inside so we had to walk from outside each time we wanted to go to our car in the freezing weather. The mezzenine room had computers and a printer (with no paper at the time of us requiring to print something around 4pm on a Saturday). We did not call to have it replaced though. It was re-stacked by Sunday morning. The lobby and elevators are a bit small compared to what I am use to. Overall the hotel was cozy, but service was not the most efficient. The prices for the rooms were reasonable making it worth the amount we paid for being in the core downtown. They charge $20 extra for an extra person in the room. Breakfast was included in the morning from 7am-10am which had many options from fruit, pancakes to yogurt. Beds and washroom were cozy. Fun trip in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: pkane
Reviews.Content: As everyone says, this hotel is in a great location. Next to shopping, metro, mont royal, bell centre, crescent and plenty of cafe's. That's the only good thing though. The walls, ceilings and floors of this hotel are paper thin! I could even hear my neighbors alarm at times. Every night(we stayed 3 nights) we were woken by dump trucks outside doing who knows what at 3am and 5am. The motor from the fridge in the room makes alot of noise as well. Traveled with another couple and they had the same issue. We stayed on different floors. The breakfast buffet was edible but it was a zoo in there when we went the first day. Messy and out of control. Skipped it the other days. Hotel is outdated as you'd expect but it was clean. I'd rather spend a few extra dollars next time for a nicer hotel and quieter rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean, nice extra touches!”
Reviews.Author: abcMass
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter on a visit to look at McGill University. The location is super convenient to McGill, downtown Montreal and public transportation. Breakfast and wireless are included in the very reasonable price. Cookies in the lobby in the afternoon were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Best for the Downtown Stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyToTravel06
Reviews.Content: I stayed here some time back when I arrived to Montreal. As I have stayed earlier as well in other Residence Inns, there are not much surprises. Morning Breakfast is provided. Staffs are very helpfull. One of the best about this hotel is its location...very very close to all of the downtown action...Metro station is just 50 ft away...St.Catherine and Cresent streets are very close... the rooms and floor walkways will give a feel that you are in your own apartment building. If you are planning for a long time stay then this hotel will surely make you feel that you are in your own apartment :) Overall it is a very good downtown hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the City!”
Reviews.Author: wholisa85
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Great Location! Great Staff! The hotel is right in the heart of the city and you can walk everywhere in downtown. The metro half a block away which will connect you to Old Montreal and the rest of the city. Really great location; I can't stress that enough! The staff is also awesome! We asked them a million questions a day and they always had good recommendations/suggestions/advice. They were all very pleasant and they were eager to help and and answer questions. I am planning to visit Montreal again and will definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “August visit”
Reviews.Author: SRfromMA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in mid-August 2011 with my husband and 2 kids (teenagers). Great location. Peel station is right around the corner and several bus routes are on Peel or nearby. Breakfast was ok - I've had better, but the dining area can become very crowded at peak breakfast times. The wait staff was quick to clear tables when people were finished. The bathroom was very small in our room - so small that the door barely clears the front of the toilet when it is opened. But the rooms were clean and we appreciated the mini-kitchen which was stocked with plates, pans, utensils, a microwave, dishwasher and full size fridge. We brought a lot of snacks along.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: vttico
Reviews.Content: My partner and I enjoyed a really nice stay here; good room on the 20th floor with a huge bed, free wi-fi, a cute little kitchen, and a small bathroom. The view would have been nice, too, if there had not been an ugly piece of plywood screening the air conditioner! Staff made a real effort to keep the hotel quiet on this busy holiday, and succeeded. Breakfast was plentiful and served in a nice room on the mezzanine. Note that parking meters in the immediate area don't become effective until 1 PM on Sunday, so you can park overnight on the street for free until then. For dinner, try the Steak Frites overlooking the harbor in the Old Montreal area on St. Laurant Boul. just off St. Paul St. If you're in town for New Year's Eve, don't miss the festivities on Place Jacques Cartier including wonderful fireworks at midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: SMP1212
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with some friends during the Christmas weekend. Location is great, close to restaurants and shopping as well as a very short walk to Peel metro. Although the rooms look a little old, they are very spacious and clean. Only complaint was that the bathrooms are extremely small. Wi-fi and breakfast are included which is great. The hot breakfast was a definite plus. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Judith C
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a couple of days in December. The staff was excellent, in my opinion staff can make or break a hotel. The hotel was centrally located for downtown Montreal. The room was spacious, clean and great for four people. Although the Hotel was not new it was clean and tastfully decorated. Beds were comfortable and the hot breakfast was well stocked with a good range of choices. It was well priced and would not hesitate to stay there the next time I go to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Joseph T
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2-night stay here. The location was very good, right off of Peel and close to many of the museums. I appreciated the free in-room wireless, good hot breakfast, cookies in the evenings and kind desk staff. I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fair Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeanH1999
Reviews.Content: Nice location in central Montreal but not your typical Residence Inn. It seems to be a hotel that was converted into this brand. Breakfast which is included is typical for Residence Inns. Parking is expensive but not more than any other city. Nice rooftop terrace with seats and a great view of the city. Close t the subway. Most of their suites are studios vs. one bedrooms. Not suitable if traveling with a family.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Dedphred
Reviews.Content: Our room was on a high floor, in the back, so we did not get noise from Peel Street which some reviewers have complained about. We very much enjoyed having a kitchen for leftovers and for a little bit of cooking. The buffet breakfast was outstanding. There are lots of choices, hot and cold. We were there for seven days and the breakfast had lots of variety during that time. The hotel was very full while we were there, and breakfast was sometimes crowded, but the food was restocked quickly and there was always plenty to choose from. We were not bothered by noise but we did wish that there had been a window in our room that could have been opened. Perhaps when the hotel is remodeled this could be considered. The location was perfect--we could walk to almost everything and public transport was very close by. It is a busy downtown location, but that's part of the fun. That busy location provides wonderful restuarants all around the hotel and the entire underground city is accessible on the corner. Overall a very successful stopover!!

Reviews.Title: “Theft”
Reviews.Author: 2ForDinner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here recently for our 30th anniversary. In short, we went to dinner one night and came back to find our room broken into and our laptop, phones and camera stolen. We were obviously followed or watched. Management promised us Marriott would reimburse us for our stolen items. After working with them for three weeks they reneged saying they weren't legally liable under hospitality laws. Could have said that up front. Wooden door frames easily broken through, no cameras on floors, and anyone off the street can go up the stairs or the elevator. As far as hotel goes, good location, worst valet parking we've experienced, and the air conditioners take up most of the window so there really isn't much of a view. Obviously we are biased based on our experience, but we'd recommend another hotel that takes big city security more seriously.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Alejandro V
Reviews.Content: WeÂ´re the Vargas Nessi Family, we stayed at this hotel for 14 nights in mid-October, 2011, so I consider being very knowledgeable of the nice things this great hotel and Montreal downtown has to offer. We were on this trip to celebrate our 25 years wedding anniversary at the Saint JosephÂ´s Oratory so the downtown location was excellent, right in the center of everything for us. There was a one minute walk to the Metro just across the street at the corner where we could take it and go from Peel station to Guy Concordia station then get the bus and stop at CÃ´te-des-Neiges area to get to the Oratory. Our room was fairly large and very, very clean a lot of space for the luggage in the walk in closed. The TV was nicely located and with a good selection of HD channels in english and French. The free Wi-Fi is also a great bonus. The breakfast selection was huge and exquisite, staff did an admirable job of keeping buffet supplied, every day was something a little different, special thanks to Katherine, Victor, Lyssette and the rest of the kitchen staff, they were very helpful with suggestions of places to see and things to do. Front desk staff was very helpful with suggestions of places to eat and visit, thanks Juan, ItÂ´s typical at hotels to find a nice person in the staff but here every one had a kind treat and a sincere, genuine and honest smile with a continuous disposition to offer help. One morning at breakfast hour Mr. Marco A. Carelli, the Hotel General Manager, did not hesitate to approach and give us a warm welcome to Montreal and the hotel. At every moment we felt really at home not because we were at a hotel but for the home environment. BTW we liked a lot the recycling policy of the hotel. Thank you for a great time and will certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not a real Residence Inn.”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiantraveler66
Reviews.Content: Ok, I have stayed in Residence Inns by Marriott for almost 15 years. Been in the village style ones, big ones, small ones and the one in New York City. This is a hotel that was converted into a Residence Inn. The king bedded studios are small, lack any type of decor, and cramped. The room I had in NYC was smaller but better set up. But the worst this was the AC/Heating system. Baseboard heating with no AC. They have window units they take out in the fall. The problem is the windows are screwed shut. It was not comfortable at all. {And this part of the message is for some of the travelers. So what if this is a "Residential Hotel" it still isn't your home. I am an American and was embarrassed by a group of 20 something girls coming down bare foot and in PJs to the breakfast room... I don't even dress that casual in my house when company is over, why do you think it is ok to do it in a hotel in another country?!}

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Steven M
Reviews.Content: We had a quick stay at the Marriot Residence Inn, Montreal last week on our touring trip of McGill University. It was a convenient location, only a block away from McGill and close to the restaurant and upscale shopping district of Montreal. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was ready when we arrived at 12:30pm and we were able to get late check out of 1pm so we didn't have to rush back from our tour. The room was clean and the beds comfortable. The washroom was also very clean and well maintained. We didn't use the kitchen much since it was a brief stay but it was well stocked and clean. Breakfast was good and the buffet area was welll stocked. The only criticism was that we have to go from the underground parking elevator to outside to access the hotel. However, the parking was convenient and well guarded with a 24/7 Valet and video surveillence. I would recommend it. Good value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good the 2nd time...”
Reviews.Author: lipsloves2shop
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last December, and then again last week. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is a tad old - but it is certainly not reflected in the rooms. The bonus with staying here is the full continental breakfast, large rooms (with kitchenette), and location. I will continue to recommend this hotel...66

Reviews.Title: “nice downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: kcanuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in September,2011. The price was reasonable considering the downtown location, central to easily walk the city. Our room was fairly large and very clean. There seemed to be a number of Americans staying here so assume it must be a popular weekend destination for them. A good choice. The breakfast selection was adequate and their was plenty of room, we were not squashed together like sardines as some places are for breakfast . Overall,i would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: C39
Reviews.Content: Great location - right downtown, 2 minutes from the metro. Rooms were large for downtown Montreal - full kitchenette so we saved some money by cooking and storing leftovers in the fridge. Free hot breakfast was a nice bonus. The staff were very friendly. The largest downside was the noise - I was on the 6th floor facing Peel street and it was very noisy until late in the night. I would definitely stay there again, but maybe request a room on the other side or bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: David-on-the-Road
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Great location! Right in the center of everything. Front desk staff very helpful with suggestions of places to eat and things to do. Breakfast good. Recommended mainly for great location and good value. AAA rates available.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Hellnar
Reviews.Content: Very well situated, in the centre of Montreal, two minutes walk from the metro, large room, king size bed, well equiped kitchenette. Very good points : the service : friendly and helpful staff and the cleanliness of the room. Very bad point : the noise coming up from the road even on the 20th floor (we asked for a change from the 5th to the 20th) and the noise due to an old fashioned ventilation system (noisy even when stopped !). We had to sleep with ear plugs during the 6 nights we spent there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: BonVinNYC
Reviews.Content: I took my Mom to Montreal for her birthday and we had a fabulous time. The staff at the Residence Inn was fantastic. They helped us get tickets to a local show, gave us fantastic recommendations for dinner and sites and made us feel right at home. It was located 1/2 block from the Peel Street Metro Station and we could get anywhere we wanted so easily. The continental breakfast was great and the terrace on the top floor was a great way to see the city. The rooms were nice and clean and met our needs (although needs to be updated.) Thank you for a great time and will certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Lmb1961
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent two nights at this hotel over thanksgiving week-end. We arrived early in the morning but were able to check in quickly. The room is standard and was clean. Bathroom was tiny, but room was good size. Complimentary breakfast was good but very crowded. Staff did an admirable job of keeping buffet supplied. The real joy of this hotel is the proximity to shopping, nightlife and great restaurants within walking distance. The hotel is not luxurious or modern but I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE SMELL!!!! MOLDY.”
Reviews.Author: travleinggirl
Reviews.Content: Awful room with a terrible smell checked in and quickly checked right out. We tried to switch rooms but the a/c was broken in the other one and it still smelled like rotting carpet, mold mixed with cheap mens cologne (the airfreshner they spray OVER the smell). The room itself was very old and dirty, stains on the carpet and walls. ALSO they tried to charge a PET FEE for a service dog, which is illegal in MOST countries AND a worker walked into our room with their key without knocking first. I'd pay $289 a night JUST TO NOT HAVE TO SLEEP HERE. What a total ripoff. I cant fathom how this hotel got ANY good reviews? Where are you people use to sleeping in a barn??? Avoid at all costs, pictures to follow.

Reviews.Title: “Showing its Age but Would Stay Again - Great Exercise Room”
Reviews.Author: Floatman
Reviews.Content: I am Marriott gold member and agree with the previous posts that the hotel is showing its age, but this is still a good place to stay in a very good location. Hotel is clean, free internet, free breakfast, staff is very helpful and location is quiet enough for a downtown hotel. A pleasant surprise was the size of the gym, It's huge. Plus, there is a full service gym right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Silly77
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I traveled to montreal last week with my cousin and bourfirend. So there was a total of 4 of us, with two rooms. When we arrived. Parking sucks. We had to do valet because the parking lot was so small we didn't even know how to park our van. And on top of that, we believe that while our van was parking downstairs for the 3 days we were there, someone scratched our front bumper. I don't blame the hotel for this..it could've been anyone..but that did happen... Any who.. Once we parked and made our way to the front desk, they staff was great! They gave us connecting rooms side by side. They have cookies waiting for you too during the afternoon hours:) Yum! The elevators were tiny.. But I expected that... They have breakfast included in your room fee so that s great because everyday was something a little different, so we were glad they changed it up! My fiancÃ© loved the waffle maker! I loved the raisin toast! The location is amazing!! You're literally 2 blocks away from St. Catherine's road, where all the shopping happnes. And you're a stone throw away from the entrance to the underground malls. Another thing we liked about staying in downtown was that we were able to WALKZ EVERYWHERE!!! It s pretty great! Since the drivers in Montreal are really aggressive! Granted..sometimes we walked REALLY FAR away... But it was good exercise because we ate way too much!! The rooms were very clean, the beds were somewhat comfy... I like a firm bed... They had great tv channels, we had a little kitchen table chairs, and sitting area. I really liked the room. Although we got two double beds instead of just one queen. We didn't complain though it was good. I would come back again to stay

Reviews.Title: “Needs refurbishment!”
Reviews.Author: jdoberursel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location in downtown Montreal. From the outside it looks very tired and even more so inside the hotel. The decor is shabby and although the hotel is clean the colour scheme makes it look dirty! Service is good, but the breakfast was very poor. The breakfast room is far too small for a hotel of this size - and many times it was very packed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: DanielmyBrother
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and found the location was perfect compared to the hotel being just average. The rooms were very small compared to other locations we stayed. Still it was very clean and the staff were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a Week at Residence Inn Montreal Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Brenda E
Reviews.Content: I had to spend a week working in Montreal and stayed at the Residence Inn Montreal Downtown. My husband was with me on vacation. The week was really great for him and he was able to see so many sites thanks to the frontdesk staff. They are very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. They will take the time to show you on the map the best places to visit. The rooms are clean and comfortable and breakfast are plentful and very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: jojo2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn on Friday, Sept 23rd 2011. Great service. First, I had called the night before inquiring about parking for an early arrival. The clerk said no problem, we can leave the car and they can take car of our bag. She put a note on file to advise we would be at the hotel around 09h00. When we checked in, the room was not ready, which didn't bother me because we were there so early. They kept our bags and we could park the car. They offered to call us when our room would be ready. We got a call around 11h00. We checked in slighty after and our bags were already in the room. WOW. The room is great, the bed is confortable, flt screen TV, free pop-corn. The next moring we had breakfast with great selection. I loved their waffles!! Would I go back? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: ckahari
Reviews.Content: My family were vacationing in Montreal and we sepent 3 nights at this Hotel. The rooms were superb, breakfast was super and the staff topped it all - very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Moyen, better elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: JulesVerneJr
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay here b/c other ratings were favorable and its location. The hotel is a bit dated, they only offer self parking and it is around the corner, and the room itself was noisy. The kitchenette was dated and the fridge was so noisy that I had to unplug it. Further, the room only had a window-unit a/c. Well it was already cool in Montreal so I didn't need to have it on. This allowed outside noise to filter into the room all night long. An average stay, but I'll definitely stay elsewhere on a return business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Hzhou
Reviews.Content: Very good free breakfast-there are more choices than the ones I paid 15$ in Best Western Plus. Very convenient location, steps away from Peel station, four blocks away from Rue Crescent, where you should find restaurant right for you, 10 min. walk to Mount Royal. The self parking garage is just around conner. The staff are so friendly and could not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Regina S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights during the last week of August. Very good location, nice kitchen, excellent room size. The breakfast, included in the price, was a treat! The room is a bit outdated and the mattress is not the best quality, but everything clean and the staff is very helpful. The biggest minus is the absent of the direct access to your car. In overall, we enjoyed or stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was lovely”
Reviews.Author: noboston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Residence Inn by Marriott from Sept. 1/11 - Sept. 4/11. Overall the hotel was lovely. The hotel is not modernized, but it was very comfortabel. It has a kitchen, and the room is much larger than a regular hotel room. There was a pull-out sofa bed, a dining table as well. Room was very clean. One night we even cooked, and the next morning the cleaners had cleaned and washed the dishes. Breakfast was complimentry, and it was pleasant. The parking was next door, and it was a bit expensive and inconvenient, but overall, the expereince we had at this hotel was satisfied. Very close to downtown. Hotel front staff were extrememly helpful, nice and friendly, and we would defniately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect from Residence inn”
Reviews.Author: kpoconnor
Reviews.Content: Stayed two days week of September 5th. Hotel is in great location near many restaurants and shops. Clean hotel. Had high definition Flat Screen TVs. Beds were comfortable with nice sheets. AC is a window unit rather noisy. Bathroom one of the smallest I have ever used. Breakfast was included. Limited selection but did have Waffles, egges and cereal. Parking garage is next door with very tight spaces. I would stay there again but not my first choice. Staff were all very friendly and spoke both french and English. Wifi was also included. As for a business stay this worked.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: buddysmom2307
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and spacious. Hot buffet breakfast offered plenty of choices. This is my second stay at this hotel and I would not hesitate to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: mykonos20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 3 nights. This room was a studio and was very nice. Had everything we needed. The Metro was about 1/2 block away and could get to any part of the city. The airport 747 bus stopped 3 blocks away. It was an easy walk to the hotel. The staff of the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very good and we had no trouble finding somewhere to set. They had three computers in the breakfast room and they were free of charge. Very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: dralpy
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent. Wonderful complimentary breakfast. However, room had a strange odor and TV was problematic. Bed was very hard. For what I paid (priceline) it was well worth it but I would hesitate at their regular rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: G9508
Reviews.Content: The 4 of us stayed there for 2 nights in a spacious room with 2 double beds and sofa. Got a very spacious room with a kitchenette and a walk-in closed. Plenty of room for all, even after we opened the sofa bed. Clean, air conditioned. Not new, but well maintained. The hotel is very centrally situated, however we had no problems driving in and out. There are reserved spots right outside the hotel for checking in and out, and a valet parking garage in the same building. The parking does not belong to the hotel, but there is an arrangement between them. One can choose to park at a higher hotel price with unlimited in/out privileges, or just directly at the parking garage, which might be cheaper. The included breakfast was good, though the dining room was overcrowded at certain times. Free wireless Internet connection worked fine. The hotel location is great, central streets with shops and restaurants just down the block. The metro station is also close by, though we did not use it, driving in the city instead (it was a weekend). If you have some spare time - go up to the roof. There is a nice open terrace and a gym there. Great views and good air! Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_GD26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Year's with my wife, and was a great experience. The hotel is in a great location, but a bit of a hike to Old Montreal. The hotel is very clean, spacious rooms, and has a good breakfast. Overall, a great stay, and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Lora83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right downtown, so very conveniently located. I loved that. The room looked a little old and like it need some refurnishing, but overall it was good. All the appliances in the kitchen were useful and working well. The only downside of it was the breakfast room -there are only a few tables and they're always taken, so you need to either wait or sit next to someone else... but the food choice was fair, and quality too. I liked that it had a waffle-maker!!! :) The staff was super friendly and helpful -a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: maverik19
Reviews.Content: We had forgot our baby's crib and by the time we got to our room, someone was ip installing one for us. Included breakfast is excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - right next to McGill University”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl2009_9
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel since we were touring McGill University with our daughter. The location was fantastic. The parking is a bit tricky to get to. I think the rooms may be due for a reno. Would have preferred to have queen size beds but we were stuck with doubles. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Czardemars
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what we expected, two beds plus a sofa bed in the studio suite. Free breakfast, safe atmosphere, pretty easy to get about. Other reviews are accurate regarding tight space for breakfast. We enjoy a fitness challenge, so we walked up to the 20th floor. Dinning nearby is very expensive. The underground city is just a mall. The trip advisor #1 rated 4-hour bike tour was fabulous, best part of our journey. $300 for four of us, I didn't think to try and negotiate lower. Be sure to walk to the top of Mont Royal...just hang a right outside the hotel and walk to the top of Peel Street. If you take the stairs you'll be at the top in 30 minutes from the hotel. If you want to stroll, follow the path and it will take about an hour--any age can do it! Should have brought my running gear to jog up the trail. Bike friendly city!

Reviews.Title: “Location and terrace with a view”
Reviews.Author: montepink
Reviews.Content: Good location - in the vibrant part of the downtown AND next to Peel metro station (a very short ride to Old Port and Latin Quarter). Four stops from the bus station (Berri-UQAM). Very nice terrace on the 23rd floor. Breakfast 7-10:30, adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Nice location”
Reviews.Author: angelak411
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Montreal. First time to Montreal for the whole family and we stayed at the Residence Inn because of the extra bed, pull out couch for my kids and free breakfast.. The Residence Inn is close to Mount Royal, Crescent Street(where there are restaurants and shops and is close to the subway. We chose to use the subway and keep the car parked for the entire time there and it was very easy(paid for 3 day unlimited subway pass). Rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious for a family of 4. There is a rooftop terrace that has amazing views of the city. There is also coin laundry facilities on the terrace floor too. It is only 3 stops from Old Montreal on the subway and less expensive than some of the hotels there. The only negative is that the beds were a little worn and sagged in the middle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: jl21Va
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice place to stay. Here are the pros and cons PROS: I was impressed with the woman that handled my check-in process. She was able to answer my questions as well as get me into an upgraded room. All of this was about 4 hours before check-in time as well. Nice work! The room was very clean. I think its maybe an older hotel, but you would not know it from the room, or common areas. Very well maintained. The location was close to metro and bus routes which made it easier to get to Old Montreal or other destinations around the city. CONS: The main issues seemed to be that hotel does not really have the infrastructure to comfortable handle the number of guests that it can hold. For instance, there were 3 very small elevators (one of which was typically dedicated to housekeeping staff) serving 23 floors. This meant that there was usually a line waiting for the elevators and this could sometime take more than five minutes. Also the breakfast room was always crowded and it was very difficult to get a seat. There was no assistance with bags at the front door loading/unloading area. Despite the cons, I was happy with my choice to stay here. The location and cleanliness made it well worth the inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “OLD WORLD CHARM”
Reviews.Author: Here4aGoodtime
Reviews.Content: When travelling to Montreal, I would definetly recommend staying at this hotel, great value. It is conveniently located in downtown Montreal/McGill U, within minutes of public transit and 32 Km of underground shopping! thirty minutes away from Old Montreal on foot. Had to pay daily rate of $25 for parking but when you consider that you have unlimited in and out privileges and the fact that street parking cost us $12 for four hours of parking! not a bad deal. Hot breakfast included,kids loved waffels-don't forget to tip staff. Kitchenette great option.Fitness centre was good. Staff was friendly,helpful and very courteous. Hotel needs some minor update and elevators were slow,no on site restaurant

Reviews.Title: “We always go back here”
Reviews.Author: Joe Plut
Reviews.Content: This may be the 10th or 12th time, if not more, that we have stayed at the Residence Inn on rue Peel. The location is right in the middle of downtown and walkable to hockey games, festivals, pubs on Crescent Street, shopping on rue Ste. Catherine. Parking is in a underground garage and safe, and the Metro (subway - clean and safe) is on the corner - taking you anywhere in the city that you don't want ot walk or taxi. What we like as much as the convenience, are that the hotel is always very clean and modern, and ALL of the employees - not just one or two - - are always so friendly to us and all the other guests, speaking fluently in French or English. This is the front desk, the managment team, housekeeping and the breakfast staff (hot breakfast buffet incldued).

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Ksmith137
Reviews.Content: There is no pool. The elevators are small and very difficult to get in the morning. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ok Service”
Reviews.Author: Imagination92
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family from July 4 to July 9, we had 2 suites connecting which were in good size. Bath room is small but clean. Internet Service was not consistent, almost everyday there was inturption in internet service. When called the desk, answer was always we know and working on it. Location is great , close to shopping and food. Hotel breakfast room is too small for number of rooms in the hotel. Item selection was good but very difficult to find a table in the morning as it was always full of people. Parking is around the corner and is not linked with the hotel building. It was not a problem since we stayed in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located, so-so hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CDunphy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located when visiting Montreal, some great shopping and restaurants in the immediate area (Holt Renfrew, Ste-Catherine St, Feirrera's, Le Taj, etc), but the hotel itself was only so-so. Friendly staff greeted us. The hotel's elevators are slow and very small, so we ended up walking down 14 flights of stairs in the morning. The rooms are large, clean, but nothing fancy. Beds could use an upgrade. The breakfast in the morning was standard hotel fare, hot and cold and some healthy options. The layout of the dining room was strange - very long buffet but right alongside tables, so people would bump tables as they served themselves. Overall, not a bad experience but nothing too exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Super Place to Stay can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Montreal085
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay - very clean and within walking distance of great food, shopping and the Metro. Staff is just wonderful, they are friendly and if you need help with anything they are more than happy to assist. The rooms are kept very clean each day. The Breakfasts are just awesome - hot and cold food served everyday. Great place to stay while you are in wonderful Montreal!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Why would you want to go elsewhere ?”
Reviews.Author: MoniqueQuebec_Canada
Reviews.Content: Whenever we go to Montreal and this is several times a year, we stay at the Marriott Residence Inn on Peal Street. Actually, this hotel has been our home away from home for the last 5 years. It offers big beautiful clean rooms with a king size bed or two double beds with full equipped kitchenette with bar stools and some big enough with a dining room table. All rooms have a living room area with a foldout couch. Even stayed in the one bedroom suite with separate bedroom and living room areas with TVs in each room. Bathrooms are small but functional, practical and clean and all rooms have large closets. The price of your stay includes a full breakfast buffet in the beautiful Mezzanine dining room overlooking Peal Street. In this room you will also find three computers with free access to the Internet, a big flat screen TV and a big comfy leader couch. On the top floor you have access to a laundry room ($). And should you want to wait while doing your laundry, you will find some very comfortable chairs overlooking the roof top terrace with tables and parasols and lounge chairs offering you a view of the Montreal skyline. Thereâ€™s also a gym, which we have never used. A bonus for some people, this hotel is pet friendly. There is indoor underground parking available; $25 for overnight parking. You can not beat the location of this hotel. As soon as you walk out, you have access to numerous restaurants, bars and plenty of shopping and walking distance to Place des Arts and of course to the location of the famous Montreal Jazz Festival. The front desk employees are polite, courteous, professional and helpful. They will take care of your needs. They will make restaurants and excursion reservations. Theyâ€™ll get you tickets, call a taxi, etc. And should you decide to stay longer, they will even do your grocery shopping, for free. When you have all of this, why would you want to go elsewhere?

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back in August 2011”
Reviews.Author: kurttackoor
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for business or pleasure. Conveniently located in downtown Montreal in the middle of everything. Numerous restaurants around and situated in the middle of all the shopping. Staff are all friendly and extremely helpful. Can't figure where to eat, ask the front desk...........they are well versed in all the restaurants around. Stayed here for a business trip and will be back in August. Can't see myself staying anywhere else, after all its a Marriott.........need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdNauseum
Reviews.Content: Just checked into this Marriott Residence Inn. Took it because this is a family weekend for my wife and I just wanted a low-cost clean place to sleep that has great Air Conditioning. Before I start. PEOPLE, Air Conditioning is such an important aspect of the enjoyment of any hotel to many people especially during the summer months. I LOVE air conditioning and it really bugs me that of the 100's of reviews of hotels I have read, there are hardly any comments on air conditioning. Please, state how you find the quality of the air conditioning so other people who might want to stay at a particular hotel will know what to expect in terms of the quality of air conditioning. 1) Air Conditioning: It works PERFECTLY. And as I stated, I love a cool room. 2) Cleanliness: Clean as can be. Everywhere. 3) Bed: It's a king size, but the mattress is a low quality brand. 'Springy' might be a good way to explain it. 4) TV: Big plasma screen. Since it's Montreal Quebec, there is not a whole lot of English channels. Not the hotels fault. It the quebecois separatists. 5) Work Area and Internet Access: Work area is good, decent sized table and good chair. Internet is included in the price and it's fast. 6) Kitchenette: It has fridge, small stove, freezer, dish washer, and microwave. But I'm Jewish and eat out :) This is what I would call a budget hotel. And for a budget hotel, its good. I am a very fussy person. I would not stay in any hotel less than the quality offered here. So when you read my posts (my handle is Adnauseum) you'll know you are reading from someone that knows what is good and what is not. If you are looking for a clean, efficient comfortable room in Montreal for a decent price, I recommend the Marriott Residence Inn. It's right smack downtown with lots of restaurants and action all around. My wife shops Escada and its just around the block!

Reviews.Title: “Great location when staying in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Rocks_to_travel
Reviews.Content: The location: I stayed in this hotel for three days during the Formula 1 race in June 2011. The hotel is perfectly located for taking in the festivities of the race. It is located on Peel Street, which is blocked off just down the road 100m. They have a big outdoor party there. They bring in many exotic cars that you can look at. It is only two blocks away from Crescent Street, which is the main party area for the F1. Great restaurants. During non peak times, it is about a $40 cab ride from the airport. There is a Metro/Tube/Subway station a one minute walk away which opens up the rest of the city. Very well located for this. You cannot buy any tickets at the hotel, but they are readily available at the station. The attendant at the station spoke perfect English and was very helpful for us (and friendly as well). The hotel: I would rate this hotel a solid 3 star, maybe even 3.5. The rooms are quite large and the one we had included a kitchen. There were a couple of bar stools in the kitchen which allows you to eat at the counter. The rooms are in need of some updating, as it has been quite some time since they were renovated. The room was very clean and had a large LCD TV (one of the biggest I have seen in a hotel). The bathroom was somewhat cramped, but contained a full bath tub with a good shower head. They had a window type air conditioner which was not bad. Usually they are too loud for me but this one was relatively quiet. The staff was very friendly and helped us out tremendously during our stay and always did it with a smile. They have a relatively small lobby (actually very small). There is a small sitting area. There is a breakfast room on the second floor (first floor if you are European). The breakfast was not that great. It is a little bit more than a continental and included a spot to make fresh waffles, had yogurt and toast. In addition they offered poached eggs, sausage paddies (not so great) and hash brown paddies. There were also several juices, coffee and tea. Of course during the F1 race, every hotel charges almost double, so I cannot really comment on the value on this trip. I think if I were staying during a non-peak time, the value would be good. I would stay there for sure if I were to visit Montreal again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: paddling_kiki
Reviews.Content: 4 of us shared a room with a kitchen for a sporting event during October. The kitchen was rather small, and the pull out couch rather lumpy, but otherwise, a perfectly acceptable stay. What was nice about the hotel was the morning breakfast, and the healthy options that aren't often provided with free breakfasts. Another bonus - this hotel is literally a stone's throw from all the places to go in MTL - but you'd be best off to park behind the hotel at an outdoor lot. You'll save some $$ that way!

Reviews.Title: “Just one thing missing”
Reviews.Author: KenandLia
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great service, large room with kitchenette, full size fridge, dining area, sitting area, Wifi, continental breakfast in the lobby - the works! Unfortunately, they don't have parking. You must unload your luggage at the door, check-in and then drive your car to the next building for underground parking in one of the dingiest parking garages I have ever been in. The hairpin turns and parking attendant who races down after you were enough to turn me off. Thankfully, the bellman volunteered to cart my luggage to the parking exit located down a back alley past the garbage dumpsters where I entrusted my bags to someone who I assumed was the parking attendant. At least he waved when I exited! A charming little boutique hotel, next to a fairly good (but pricey) sushi restaurant in the heart of downtown Montreal. If they added valet parking, they would get five stars from me. No need for a dining room as the restaurants nearby outclass anything Marriott could muster.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: msp081
Reviews.Content: First of all, we booked on Priceline and got a super deal. We knew we weren't booking the W or Fairmont, so for a Marriott it was great. The location is super, the rooms are clean. We stayed here for the free wireless, great location (near metro, bixi, McGill) and it also had a free breakfast and in-room kitchen. For what we paid it was an amazing deal. You know when you stay here that it won't be a 4 or 5 star hotel, but for what it is we thought it was super.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: keatingfamily
Reviews.Content: I am writing this from the middle of a three night stay. I have started to do this more to remember the little details better. It may be important to note that I am an American, used to American hotels if that matters. Pros: Location is very good relative to where my office is on Peel Street. Shower works well and has a massage head. Generally a very clean property. Cost is not outrageous. Wireless internet is configured properly and does not create problems with any email accounts as is common with many hotels these days. Work space is adequate. Guests all seem very nice and this is a plus with the RI brand - more down to earth guests. Cons: Loud, even on the 18th floor the street noise is enough to keep me awake. Smaller room than most Residence Inn properties I stay in. Bed is terribly uncomfortable for me - hard as a rock. I am used to Tempurpedic at home and this bed is killing me. Food is lame compared to most Residence Inns. Last night they had some lettuce, tomatoes, pinto beans and store bought tortilla chips and salsa. Today was a little better - burgers with the same skimpy salad items. Breakfast was a little better but not what I'm used to seeing at an RI property. Elevators are tiny and slow - I got tired of waiting and actually walked down 18 flights of stairs this evening. There isn't anything terribly wrong with the hotel. I don't think the staff is wonderful as some have claimed. They had opportunities to go the extra mile for me and never did. Neither did they make life harder for me than it needed to be. You could well come here and be very happy. I will try somewhere else the next time I visit our office here.

Reviews.Title: “could not warm up to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelsalotAlbanyNy
Reviews.Content: Have no real reason but did not care for this Marriott. It was ok, check-in was fine. The hotel is old but redone. The rooms walls are paper thin so we could hear the baby screaming in the room next to us all night. The breakfast in the morning was fair. Easter for us but not in Canada. Brought towels when asked- 3 towels 4 people.Needed better lighting in the bathroom. Within walking distance of everything-well not Old Montreal-too chilly for that walk. Seemed small every where- elevators fit 4 and 1 bag barely. Parking was tight but always is in the city. Used to always stay at the Delta and will probably go back there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay, then a great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: boatnuts
Reviews.Content: Fast check-in and off street parking. After check-in; received $25 gas card . Courteous bilingual staff The hotel and room looked updated. The breakfast was buffet style and has a comfortable dining room with public computers available for surfing the web The people of Montreal are very accommodating to traveling American's Can$ to US$ was 1 to 1 and US$ accepted through out city

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: fredcurson
Reviews.Content: From reservation, through checkout, the service was excellent, the staff was friendly, the room was clean, and the over all comfort was superb. Close to St Catherines and shopping. Close to my meetings. Lots of good places to eat in walking distance. Exceptionally convenient breakfast with lots of selection. All at a price that was less then most of the surrounding single room hotels. Well done Marriott, I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A few things missing...”
Reviews.Author: TerriandAdam
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel tons of times over the years, and although it is consistently clean and the service and free breakfast are excellent, there are a few things missing. I believe it depends what floor or room you have, but this time my room did not have air conditioning or blackout curtains, which makes for uncomfortable sleeping. I think there used to be individual AC units in the windows of each room, but this time when I called down they indicated that there was central AC in the hotel, not individually controlled AC in each room. I told them my room was 23 degrees and had been 24 the night before. They said they would send someone up to try to fix it...? I went out and on my return it was a half degree lower but at was it. In addition, this is the only hotel I have ever stayed in that there were not curtains you could close - this room only had sheers, and the light shone in all night. I think maybe on a high floor the light would not be a concern but on the 6th where I was it was an issue. Those things said, this is a great hotel, it's always clean, they provide great service, and the included breakfast is always good. I think you have to ask many questions about your specific room when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel - courteous, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: tnt1230
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay here again! The staff was helpful and happy, offered recommendations for a restaurant, gave us a map when they knew we were about to go sightsee. The complimentary breakfast was better than we imagined... french toast, waffles, eggs, sausage, fresh fruit, pastries... we expected cereal and bread and instead had a wonderful hot meal to start our day. Definitely will come back again if ever in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Small and tight”
Reviews.Author: martymnm
Reviews.Content: Normally Residence Inn's are spacious and up to date, this property is small and very worn down. My wife had just had surgery on her foot and was in a wheelchair, the parking was a challenge, the elevators did not fit a wheelchair and the rooms and bathrooms were tiny. The staff was of little help during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Right place, right location !!”
Reviews.Author: Sanju_Chacko
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at Marriot Residence Inn on a recent business trip in early 2010 for around a month as it was recommended by my client. It was quite simply spot on. It is at the most perfect location in downtown Montreal. The locale is surprisingly quiet and just a stone's throw from the busy and fashionable downtown streets and well connected to the rest of the city. The rooms are quite cozy and the service is right. All amenities expected from a four star hotel is available here. The only negative is the lack of a restaurant, (although a kitchen is available in the suite) It is the right mix of home comforts of a Bread & Breakfast and the class expected from Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: habsfan93
Reviews.Content: Our visit was a mixed bag. First, the good points. The hotel is located near a metro stop and is walking distance to the Bell Centre. Also, the room was very, very clean which is a huge plus. The staff was very friendly and helpful, they recommended a great restaurant for smoked meat. Now, the bad. The central location means you hear a great deal of traffic noise at night so if you're a light sleeper, be advised. Also, the room was too hot. We complained but maintenance said they couldn't do anything which was disappointing so we ended up leaving windows opened. This is an old building and not all up to Residence Inn's usual standards. I can't understand why this hotel was rated so highly on tripadvisor. Gym was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Location is fantastic...rooms getting outdated”
Reviews.Author: CharlesMoncton
Reviews.Content: The Residence Inn in downtown montreal is RIGHT in the heart of the city. You are literally a 3 minute walk to St. Catherine's and all the sights and sounds you would want from the city. The underground shopping entrance is half a block away, and you can walk for miles shopping. The subway (called METRO in Montreal) is right there as well. The room was smaller than I anticipated, even with the tiny kitchen. If you are used to the newer style of Residence Inns, then you will be disappointed. It certainly does not meet those standards. The rooms are older, and it shows in the details. The elevator will drive you crazy, as they are very small, and slow. At peak times, you'll find yourself waiting and waiting.... The full fridge is a plus. No having to get buckets of ice to cool your beer! It's quite small inside, with a very tiny lobby. Lots of floors (23?) but only about 10 rooms per floor. Found it VERY quiet though, and it was busy with concert goers when we were there. (Bell Centre only 10 minute walk away or $6 by cab) Breakfast was impressive. Quite a selection for a free hotel buffet. It gets busy though, so be patient. Breakfast closes early Mon-Fri. This hotel is infamous for the falling slab of stone off of the front of the building. Back in July 2009, a piece came off and fell through th atrium of the sushi restaurant in front. Ouch! I didn't encounter any ghosts though... The cab driver told us this story when we arrived. You're not at any risk though, just a pretty tragic story when you see the front of the building. Would stay here again if the price was fanatastic (Under $125 a night) otherwise much nicer hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal City Hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: Emirates57
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with our 3 kids for 2 nights. It was a perfect base from which to explore Montreal. The first staff, who were very friendly and helpful throughout, set a very good impression on arrival. The room itself was ideal for what we needed - 2 bedrooms and a separate living / kitchen area - for the evenings when the kids had gone to bed. The hotel is currently renovating its rooms which will also help. The pool at the top of the hotel was an additional bonus for us - a decent size as hotel views go and with stunning views of the city. Would definitley recommend this hotel for families looking for a reasonably priced base with space in Montreal

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: lipsloves2shop
Reviews.Content: The service we received was great... all staff were very helpful. The location was perfect - just off St. Catherine's! The rooms were very spacious - and I loved the fact that we had a kitchenette since we were traveling with a 1 yr old (made things really easy to clean baby bottles, etc). And the fact that there was a continental breakfast was an added bonus - and they provided a full breakfast! I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here again on my next trip. My only complaint would be the fact that they had only two small elevators - so there was a lot of waiting and we couldn't make use of the stairs with a baby and stroller.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good from every angle”
Reviews.Author: Christian10021974
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in August 2010. The hotel ranks top in every area: Rooms were very spacious and fully equiped (full kitchen including washing machine) - in essence they are large studio flats. The staff are extremely courteous and helpful. There is a rich complimentary breakfast (unlike in most North American Hotels who offer no free breakfast). The hotel is found at the core of Montreal with very easy access everywhere. The stay in the hotel made the overall stay in that great city (genuinely friendly people) perfect (only minus was the weather but the hotel could not do much about it!).

Reviews.Title: “CENTRALLY LOCATED”
Reviews.Author: redheadtraveller53
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriott in downtown Montreal. It was an excellent deal and had a full kitchen and small dining area and living room. It included a very good hot and cold breakfast as well. It is right on Peel Street so very centrally located. I would say that one negative was that Sunday night there was a HUGE fight at 3am and no one at the hotel went out and stopped it. It went on for almost an hour right in front of the hotel under our window. We did find the hotel clean and very well priced. I was a tad surprised that when I called them they quoted 200 for the room and we got it on line for 139.00. When I was standing in the lobby I was shocked to see a sign in the glass display case that said that the dates we were staying had a cost of 125.00 for 3 people in the room! I tried to get an answer from the front desk as to why we did not get that price and I got a bit of a run around from the front desk. They did store our luggage as we headed to Old Quebec for the next day and so we were coming back after that. They kindly held our luggage until our return date. The breakfast was excellent.. from hot oatmeal. cold cereal to egg and sausage sandwiches to juice and fruit and yogurt. Excellent service in the breakfast room each morning! They also had a pizza appetizer area one night. All in all a very good deal for downtown Montreal. But check internet and do not book for more than we paid!!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PolsonBoy
Reviews.Content: If we were to go back to Montreal and stay in the downtown area and be near some of the best restrants we would much like to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “This is the best value for the price I've seen in Montreal so far”
Reviews.Author: elfy10
Reviews.Content: I went for a business/leisure trip in Montreal, and each time I go, I try a different hotel. This one definitely didn't disappoint in terms of value for money (free breakfast, free Internet for little more than $100 a night). Front counter staff is friendly and perfectly bilingual. Since I almost never drive when I go to Montreal, I can't comment on the price for parking, but the subway station is LITERALLY 10 steps away from the hotel. All the action is 5-10 minutes away. For the room itself, this is a very quiet place, but it may be due to this time of the year. I thought the mattress was a little hard, but for some who like firmness, it'd be perfect. Like another reviewer has said, the bathroom is t-i-n-y, possibly the smallest I've seen in all hotels I've been in. Quite simply, two people couldn't walk into this room, not sure they could even stand. But since I was alone, it was a minor irritant. I would go back to this hotel; it would be in my list of 3-4 places I'd alternate to go to.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: thmdmph
Reviews.Content: Clean, quality hotel in downtown Montreal. Within walking distance to every thing. Friendly staff. The major drawback is no free parking. But this is common in most large metropolitan downtowns. Has decent breakfast buffet. Room was spacious.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, wonderful location and even better staff!”
Reviews.Author: sherijhowell
Reviews.Content: This has been a fantastic trip made better by our helpful friendly staff at the front desk. Whether it was which metro to take or a last minute restaurant suggestions. They were so helpful. The rooms were nice, clean and a descent size. This location is so convenient too. I highly recommend the Marriot downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Avrilx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently from Oct 21-Oct 26 for business/leisure trip. My first time staying at a Residence Inn property and I found this hotel to be very centrally located and great for exploring city of Montreal as the Metro stations are nearby and cabs are easy to flag. Rooms are not very updated, but is comfortable. I like the kitchenette, but found the bathrooms kind of tiny, but it's fine. I really enjoyed staying at the property because of the customer service. The front desk was awesome. Also, my housekeeping lady was great too. She even left me a lovely note the day before my departure thanking me for my stay. Very friendly and welcoming. Some of the highlights of this hotel is the free breakfast every morning and the free wifi-internet. The laundry room on the 23rd floor is great because I don't pack a lot, so doing laundry was convenient, and the deck overlooking downtown Montreal was very nice. I would definitely come back to this hotel next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Downtown Location/Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: ExcitedNYS
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights; easy access to Metro station, Bixi bicycle stations (use the bicycles!; excellent bike lanes and paths throughout city). Parking garage just around corner from hotel entrance. Near downtown high end shops/restaurants; near McGill University and museums. Staff very receptive to questions and gave effective advice. Breakfast buffet the usual Residence Inn wide array of eggs/cereal/breads/pastries/juice/etc. Large exercise room on top 23rd floor with rudimentary weights, mats, treadmills. Wonderful top floor outdoor patio/deck with outstanding view of city. Room and bed was clean and comfortable. I often stay at USA Residence Inns when on business trips; this property was the equal of any of those I have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big breakfast included, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: MapleLane
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for us. When we arrived at the train station it was a short walk to the tourist information office, then continued on a short walk to the hotel. On our way, we passed a Montreal restaurant of some reknown, Ferreira, as well as a very attractive Parisian-style bistro. We had booked our room through Priceline, and we got a very good deal. I was very pleased that the technology had worked but the front desk clerk who checked us in was aggressive about the Priceline deal -- I wondered if it was going to influence how we were treated. Our room was a bit cold because the in-window air conditioner was not sealed in well and air came in around it. We asked for 2 extra blankets, got one. We made no other special requests while we were there. Breakfast was included with our room rate and was great! Belgian waffles you can make yourself, specialty yogourt and musuli, hot eggs, sausage, hash browns, hot oatmeal with raisins, variety of cold cereals, large variety of bread with a commercial (fast) toaster, etc. Service to clear your table of used dishes and utensils was quick, continuous friendly but unobtrusive. Free light meal on the night of our arrival (just happened to arrive that night, think it's once a week) was convenient and appreciated. Beds were just as requested. Four pillows of varying firmness, luxurious sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, convenience and location all in one package.”
Reviews.Author: KMOberlinGrad
Reviews.Content: We discovered the Marriott Residence Inn - Montreal Downtown when making travel plans to drop our daughter off at McGill University for her first year of college. We always stay with Marriott because we love the convenience of the extra space and kitchen facilities at their Residence Inns. We have four in our family and it is not always economical or convenient to eat out for every meal. The kitchen facilities make it easy to have breakfast and snacks in our room. This particular Residence Inn on Peel St is a 2 minute walk from the gates of McGill University and extremely convenient for us. It was very clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and we have plans to stay there on future visits to our daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hellholela
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Montreal and stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Can't beat the great location and based on previous reviews, we turned in our rental car and depended on public transportation and were glad we did. The metro was across the street and Grayline Tours was 3 blocks but they still picked us up upon request. Great nightlife across the street if you're into that. Close to shops and restaurants. Everything is within walking distance. Great service from the front desk, great rec room, not too great breakfast but it's free. Beds are comfy, fluffy pillows, etc. Will definitely stay here again. We had a great time in Montreal and staying at this hotel helped.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable, convenient place to stay with many conveniences.”
Reviews.Author: ANorthLondoner
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Residence Inn Downtown Montreal is in a perfect location downtown, just across the street from the Peel Metro station, so that you can easily travel anywhere. Downtown restaurants all within walking distance. Rooms in this hotel also have a kitchenette, and there are laundry machines, and a large gym with a lot of different exercise equipment, as very practical additions to your stay. You can even walk straight up Peel to the top of Mount Royal, for a very good half-hour of exercise with a beautiful view of Montreal from the top of the mountain included.

Reviews.Title: “a real gem of a stay”
Reviews.Author: nkad
Reviews.Content: had a business stay downtown montreal and brought my wife. We both enjpyed our stay at Residence Inn by Marriott and would most certainly go there again for business and leisure. The hotel is clean and our suite with a bedroom and kitchen was well stocked and spacious. The rooftop deck was a sight to behold the restaurants esp the outdoor cafes were amaxzing. The location was very close to bus and subway just a block away and the shopping amazing with 2 malls and everything you need just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “good value in down-town”
Reviews.Author: JSMunn
Reviews.Content: Well run, in a great location. Rooms a bit smaller than other Residence Inns I've stayed in but perfectly adequate. The hot breakfast was fairly bad but that encourages you to healthier choices, or you can always skip the free breakfast and find somewhere near-by. I don't particularly like air conditioners but the windows in the room were unopenable, so fresh air was hard to get to. Staff friendly and efficient, and the location is ideal. Free wireless internet is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price - good choice!”
Reviews.Author: sr70
Reviews.Content: We booked this as part of a package, but we've been to Montreal before. It's a great location - right across the street from the Metro, in the middle of a great shopping area, and near a number of sights. The hotel was great - staff provided excellent service, and were happy to make calls and research info for us. The room was comfotable - not fancy, but really liked the kitchen, spacious enough to hang out in. Great rooftop terrace. Breakfast can get crowded and isn't delicious, but it's free. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beware room number 7!”
Reviews.Author: twasbrillig4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 1807 and were shocked at how small this room was. One look at the room map on the back of the door confirmed that this room is considerably narrower than the others. We felt like we were in a cupboard! That combined with the darkness of the room due to having an air conditioning unit stuck in the centre of the window made for a gloomy feel. In fairness, there was nothing really wrong with the room and the fact that our previous stay had been at the wonderful Residence Inn, Toronto did not help. As everyone else says, the bathroom is tiny and the location is very good, but the risk of getting that room again would prevent me from considering the hotel or recommending it. I did mention it at the front desk, but I believe they were full and hey, someone has to have the poor room and it was our turn! I do think the hotel should give these rooms to people only staying overnight only whenever possible. We were underwhelmed with the breakfast also and the evening snack food (only went once). The fresh fruit salad did not taste that fresh. Everything else was okay and we liked the waffle mixture they provided and thought that the powder sugar was a nice touch. It was the only disappointing hotel stay on our tour of eastern Canadian cities. As a result, when staying there we checked its reviews again here and also those of the higher placed hotels. This made us try the Auberge Bonaparte for dinner one evening and it was wonderful - now that I would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel went above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: mrav1980
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Montreal for a few days for a little vacation. We stayed at the Residence Inn right in the downtown area. First off, the location is great. The hotel is two blocks from St. Catherine's street, which is the main street running through Montreal, with lots of restaurants and shopping. The room was very nice and clean. You also couldn't hear any noise from other rooms or the hallway, which for me is really important as I'm a light sleeper. All that aside, what stood out the most was the service. My wife and I were unsure of whether we'd be able to catch our flight back home as our plan was to stay in Montreal for a few days, then take a train to Quebec City for two nights, then take a train back to Montreal and fly out of Montreal a couple of hours later. The Manager on duty helped us to see that it would be very difficult to make our flight. Then when we had arranged to get an earlier train back to Montreal, the manager told us we could leave our bags at the hotel while we explored Montreal, even though we would have been at a hotel in Quebec City for the previous two nights. She even wrote it down in a log they keep because she could see I was unsure about the situation. We really valued that level of personal service and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone in the future.

Reviews.Title: “two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: 1anita
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Perfect location. Great room for a family. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: jscott_langley
Reviews.Content: clean quite hotel in great location. Kudos for upgrading the workout room. Elevators are slow. Morning rush at breakfast can be daunting. Als, they really need some black out curtains. Sushi downstairs is great!

Reviews.Title: “old fashioned but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hani13
Reviews.Content: the building and the rooms are outdated but comfortable.. the bed was great.. clean, soft linens.. check in and out was super smooth.. staff helpfull.. heart of downtown.. close to metro.. only negative would be the extremely high over night parking charge other than that, would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Always accomodating”
Reviews.Author: AdventurersOtt
Reviews.Content: this is the fourth time I have used this hotel for business and every time I am pleased with the service. We are always able to check in early and when ever we have needed a late check out has been provided. Having the kitchen in our suite is a great help. Its also in a great location for the downtown center.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this very well located hotel with Ã  nice service”
Reviews.Author: Alain_Paris75008
Reviews.Content: A very good experience. This hotel is in a very good location downtown just close to Ste Catherine street. The rooms are very large, very clean and all the people wre absolutely nice. For my next trip in Montreal, I'll come back...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Roxydmb212
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night. Everything was super smooth from the early check in, parking and the comfort of the hotel room. Would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking to stay downtown! Super close to restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Teacheragain
Reviews.Content: I would definatly recommend this hotel. Great Location. 2 short blocks from St. Catherine's St. (Rue Sainte-Catherine), Montreal's main shopping street. Close to 5 colleges/univ. , the Underground City, and the Green line of the Metro is just steps away. Cresent St (rue Crescent) is only a few blocks away where you can find great restaurants and bars. Their breakfast was plentiful and on certain nights they had a light dinner too! The room was clean and large enough w/ 2 Queen beds and a pull-out sofa. If I were to go back I would request to stay in the front of the building vs the back. More to see!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and location”
Reviews.Author: clearandsunny
Reviews.Content: The staff of the hotel are first-rate and they helped make my experience very enjoyable. The hotel was very expensive that weekend and I wasn't sure why, but I paid extra to ensure that I had a guaranteed room. Upon arrival, the room type I reserved was not available and I was downgraded to the last room that they had available. Turns out that the Montreal Jazz Fest was happening that weekend and people extended their stays. They immediately offered me gift cards to make up for the problem. I protested further and they offered me cash as compensation. Totally appeased, I went on to ask about activities and the staff were wonderfully helpful. I did have a problem with my room being cleaned properly, but the problem was immediately remedied when I complained and the person who made the mistake came to apologize personally. Guillaume was especially helpful during my stay, but all the staff avail themselves to offer assistance as needed. You can't go wrong with this hotel. My only quibble was that the beds were a little uncomfortable, but sleep-able. Other than that, it is centrally located to almost every place you would want to visit.
